messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] HELP - Biographies
messages.msgSnippet: There was a sort of bio on Yoritomo by Jeffery P Mass called Yoritomo and the founding of the first Bakufu . Conrad Totman also wrote a bio on Tokugawa
messages.messageBody:
There was a sort of bio on Yoritomo by Jeffery P Mass called "Yoritomo and
the founding of the first Bakufu".

Conrad Totman also wrote a bio on Tokugawa Ieyasu.

"Kenmu: Go-Daigos Revolution" by Andrew Goble is about Go-Daigo Tenno (not
strictly bio though)

"Two Japanese Christian Heroes" by Johannes Laures SJ covers Takayama Ukon
and Hosokawa Gracia

A rather odd book I did come across was "Reflections on the Life and Times
of Motonari Mori" by Dr. Shimizu Usui. He is a medical doctor and the book
is mostly about the medical conditions of the sengoku bushi.

I heard that Jeffrey Kurashige is working on a bio of Takeda Shingen.

There is a very old article on Date Masamune in TASJ from the 1890s (vol 21
pp 1-105.)

By the way I am reading Keene's book on Yoshimasa right now. I wish someone
would write a bio on Nobunaga the size and scope of his work on Meiji tenno.

messages.subject: HELP - Biographies
messages.msgSnippet: I was noticing there are very few biographies of the major Japanese (medieval) historical characters in English. Can you confirm??? I have found: Hideyoshi
messages.messageBody:
I was noticing there are very few biographies of the major Japanese
(medieval) historical characters in English.

Can you confirm???

I have found:

Hideyoshi (1983, Berry; an older one by Dening, 1888)
Nobunaga (2001, printed in Holland, limited)
Ieyasu (1937, Sadler)
Ashikaga Yoshimasa (2003, Keene)
Ashikaga Yoshimitsu (never published, as far as I know)
Taira no Kiyomori ( " )
Takeda Shingen ( " )
...
There was one on Yoritomo, but I can't remember...

can you confirm the above? Do you know of any other...?
thanks!

cepo
